de.mrapp.android.adapter.list.selectable

Interface SelectableListAdapter<DataType>

  • Type Parameters:
    DataType - The type of the adapter's underlying data
    All Superinterfaces:
    Adapter<AbsListView>, java.lang.Cloneable, DataStructure, EnableStateListAdapter<DataType>, FilterableListAdapter<DataType>, ItemStateListAdapter<DataType>, ListAdapter<DataType>, Loggable, Parameterizable, RecyclerViewAdapter, Restorable, java.io.Serializable, SortableListAdapter<DataType>
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    MultipleChoiceListAdapter<DataType>, SingleChoiceListAdapter<DataType>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractSelectableListAdapter, MultipleChoiceListAdapterImplementation, SingleChoiceListAdapterImplementation

    public interface SelectableListAdapter<DataType>
extends ListAdapter<DataType>
    Defines the interface, an adapter, whose underlying data is managed as a list of arbitrary items, of which one or multiple items can be selected, must implement. Such an adapter's purpose is to provide the underlying data for visualization using a AbsListView widget.
    Since:
    0.1.0

    • Method Detail

      • addSelectionListener

        void addSelectionListener(ListSelectionListener<DataType> listener)
        Adds a new listener, which should be notified when the selection of an item has been changed.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener, which should be added, as an instance of the type ListSelectionListener. The listener may not be null

      • removeSelectionListener

        void removeSelectionListener(ListSelectionListener<DataType> listener)
        Removes a specific listener, which should not be notified when the selection of an item has been changed, anymore.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener, which should be removed, as an instance of the type ListSelectionListener. The listener may not be null

      • getSelectedItemCount

        int getSelectedItemCount()
        Returns the number of currently selected items.
        Returns:
        The number of currently selected items, as an Integer value

      • isSelected

        boolean isSelected(int index)
        Returns, whether the item, which belongs to a specific index, is currently selected, or not.
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the item, whose selection state should be returned, as an Integer value. The index must be between 0 and the value of the method getCount():int - 1, otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown
        Returns:
        True, if the item, which belongs to the given index, is currently selected, false otherwise

      • isSelected

        boolean isSelected(DataType item)
        Returns, whether a specific item is currently selected, or not.
        Parameters:
        item - The item, whose selection state should be returned, as an instance of the generic type DataType. The item may not be null. If the item does not belong to the adapter, a NoSuchElementException will be thrown
        Returns:
        True, if the item, which belongs to the given index, is currently selected, false otherwise

      • isItemSelectedOnClick

        boolean isItemSelectedOnClick()
        Returns, whether an item is selected, when it is clicked by the user, or not.
        Returns:
        True, if an item is selected, when it is clicked by the user, false otherwise

      • selectItemOnClick

        void selectItemOnClick(boolean selectItemOnClick)
        Sets, whether an item should be selected, when it is clicked by the user, or not.
        Parameters:
        selectItemOnClick - True, if an item should be selected, when it is clicked by the user, false otherwise
